caption: Table 1: Detailed hyperparameters of OFA model configuration. We list the configuration for OFA of 5 different sizes.

Table 2: Experimental results on cross-modal understanding tasks including VQA and visual entailment. Note that 
we report the best results from the previous SOTAs, and specifically SimVLM is a huge-size model comparable to 
ViT-Huge pretrained on 1.8B image-text pairs, and Florence is built with CoSwin-H and RoBERTa and it is pretrained 
on 900M image-text pairs.

Table 3: Experimental results on MSCOCO Image Captioning. We report the results on the Karpathy test split. Note 
that SimVLM and LEMON are huge-size models.

Table 4: Experimental results on the 3 datasets of referring expression comprehension, namely RefCOCO, RefCOCO+, 
and RefCOCOg. We report the Acc@0.5 on different test splits of the datasets.

Table 5: Experimental results on text-to-image generation. Models are evaluated on FID, CLIPSIM, and IS scores. 
OFA outperforms the baselines, including the concurrent SOTA N?WA. We report the results of OFA Large . Note that 
GLIDE additionally has 1.5B parameters for upsampling except for the 3.5B parameters.

Table 7: Experimental results on Gigaword abstractive summarization. We report performance on the ROUGE 
evaluation [84] 
.
Table 9: Zero-shot performance on 6 GLUE tasks and SNLI-VE.

Table 10: Ablation results of OFA. All models are pretrained for 250k steps. w/o ground. represents the removal of 
both visual grounding and grounded captioning tasks. Note that all models are only finetuned with the cross-entropy 
loss in image captioning.

Table 13: Ablation results of Trie. The removal of Trie-based search degenerates the performance on downstream tasks. 
Note that the baseline OFA Base is only pre-trained for 250k steps, which is also used in
